lines.content: This application is called Groot. It is a command line application that allows users to store a list of tasks.
1. Download the jar file from here.
2. Extract the jar file to a root folder you prefer.
3. Open command prompt and change directory to the root folder of the jar file
After opening up the application, if there was no error you shoudl see this message:
` Please find your previous list items below: `
This application automatically loads previously added tasks.
If there are no previous tasks present it will print: No items.
There are 3 different types of tasks that a user can add:
To add a todo task type:
`Now you have 1 tasks in the list.`
To add a deadline task type:
deadline "description of your task" /by "your date or time"
`Now you have 2 tasks in the list.`
To add an event task type:
event "description of your task" /at "your date or time"
`Now you have 3 tasks in the list.`
This function shows you your current list of tasks.
`Here are the tasks in your list:`
This function marks the task number that you specify as done by showing a tick in front of it.
`Nice! I've marked this task as done:`
This function deletes the task number that you specify
`Now you have 2 tasks in the list.`
This function finds the task containing the words or letters that the user specifies
`Here are the matching tasks in your list: `
This function will quit your application.
`Bye. Hope to see you again soon!`
This application automatically saves your tasks in a file, whenever you make changes in your list.
This application will detect any invalid commands, missing descriptions or dates, invalid task numbers and any other errors, and will print messages such as:
`☹ OOPS! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.`
`☹ OOPS! The date of an event cannot be empty.`
After printing an error message the application keeps running, so you can enter a new command.
- Make sure to follow the exact format given for different commands.
- Make sure there are no leading spaces in single word commands.
* The main class for running the application.
* reads existing file and saves it into a list.
* returns number of tasks in the previous list.
* @param args the input from command line.
* @throws CommandException exception for any invalid commands.
* @throws IOException exception when there is an error with the file.
* @throws ClassNotFoundException exception when class name is invalid.
public static void main(String[] args) throws CommandException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
* @param userInput the input entered by user in the command line interface.
* Parser class translates the user input into commands.
private static ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks = new ArrayList();
* Uses the user input to call methods from classes UI and TaskList.
* @throws IOException           exception when there is an error with the file.
* @throws NumberFormatException exception when numbers are no integers,
*                               or there are no leading spaces before numbers.
public static void parse() throws IOException, NumberFormatException {
* Storage class creates and saves the list as a file.
* It also reads and saves data into a list from the file.
* Creates a file and saves the task list.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @throws IOException exception if there is an error with the file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException exception if the file does not exist.
public static void save(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException {
* Reads and saves the data into list of Tasks.
* @param fileName the path of the file to read from.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @return the number of tasks already present in the text file.
* @throws IOException exception if there is an error with the file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException exception if the file does not exist.
public static int read(String fileName, ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException {
* TaskList class implements each user input, as translated from Parser class.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @param userInput the string input by the user in the command line.
* @throws IOException exception if there is en error with the file.
public static void delete(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, String userInput) throws IOException {
* marks the task number specified by user as done.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @param userInput the string input by the user in the command line.
* @throws IOException exception if there is en error with the file.
public static void done(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, String userInput) throws IOException {
* adds a "todo" task in the list of tasks.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @param userInput the string input by the user in the command line.
* @throws IOException exception if there is en error with the file.
public static void addTodo(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, String userInput) throws IOException {
* adds a "deadline" task in the list of tasks.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @param userInput the string input by the user in the command line.
* @throws IOException exception if there is en error with the file.
public static void addDeadline(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, String userInput) throws IOException {
* adds an "event" task in the list of tasks.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @param userInput the string input by the user in the command line.
* @throws CommandException exception if a command is invalid.
* @throws IOException exception if there is an error with the file.
public static void addEvent(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, String userInput) throws CommandException, IOException {
* finds any matching items in the list of tasks.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks added by the user.
* @param userInput the string input by the user in the command line.
* @throws CommandException exception if a command is invalid.
public static void find(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, String userInput) throws CommandException {
* Ui class has all the functions related to the user interface.
public static final Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Please find your previous list items below: ");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* prints the list of all tasks.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks entered by the user.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list: ");
* prints the message when a task is deleted, along with the task that is deleted.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks entered by the user.
* @param slashIndex the index of "/" in the input entered by the user,
*                   used to specify the position of date of event or deadline
public static void deleteMessage(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, int slashIndex) {
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n   " + ((Task) listOfTasks.get(slashIndex)).getType()
System.out.println("Now you have " + listOfTasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* prints the message when a task is marked as done, along with the task that is marked as done.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks entered by the user.
* @param slashIndex the index of "/" in the input entered by the user,
*                   used to specify the position of date of event or deadline
public static void doneMessage(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, int slashIndex) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n   "
* prints the message whenever a todo, deadline or event task is added,
* along with the task, and total number of tasks.
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks entered by the user.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n   "
System.out.println("Now you have " + (listOfTasks.size()) + " tasks in the list.");
* prints the error message when there are no items in the list.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS! There are no tasks in your list.");
* prints the error message when the task number specified by the user is invalid or out of bounds.
* prints an error message when there is an index exception.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS! There is an error.");
* prints an error message if there is an error with the tezt file.
* prints an error message if the text file does not exist.
System.out.println("There was no existing file, so new file created");
* prints an error message when there is no description entered by the user for a todo task.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* prints an error message when there is no description or date entered by the user for a deadline task.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS! The description or date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
* prints an error message when there is no description or date entered by the user for an event task.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS! The description or date of an event cannot be empty.");
* prints an error message if an unidentified command is entered.
* prints the message if there are no existing tasks in the list.
* prints the message when finding tasks matching the user input.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* prints the tasks matching the user input, when user enters the command "find".
* @param listOfTasks the complete list of tasks entered by the user.
* @param j the task number from list of tasks.
* @param index the index of the task from the list of tasks.
public static void findTasks(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks, int j, int index) {
* prints the error message if number entered is not an integer or does not have leading spaces.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS! no spaces found or number invalid.");
* Deadline class is used to create deadline type tasks.
* constructor class to create a deadline object.
* @param deadlineDate the date of the deadline.
* gets the date of the deadline.
* @return the date of the deadline object.
* specifies which type of task object it is.
* @return [D] which signifies that this is a deadline object.
* to convert deadline object into string.
* @return the deadline object in a string format, with its description and date.
* Event class is used to create event type tasks.
* constructor class to create an event object.
* @param eventDate the date of the event.
* gets the date of the event.
* @return the date of the event object.
* specifies which type of task object it is.
* @return [E] which signifies that this is an event object.
* to convert event object into string.
* @return the event object in a string format, with its description and date.
* Task class is used to create a Task type object.
* gets the mark which signifies if the task is done or not.
* @return tick mark or a cross mark depending on whether a task is marked as done.
* it gets the description of a particular task object.
* @return the description of a task object.
* constructor to create task type objects.
* to convert any task object into string.
* @return the task object in a string format, with its description.
* specifies which type of task object it is.
* @return [D], [E] or [T] depending on particular type of task, over-written by Deadline, Event and Todo classes.
* ToDo class is used to create todo type tasks.
* specifies which type of task object it is.
* @return [T] which signifies that this is a todo object.
